snippet: The man, who was in critical condition, had wielded two assault rifles and demanded that Pakistan adopt an Islamic system of government, paralyzing the capital for hours.
abstract: Standoff in Pakistan between a gunman and Islamabad police ends when suspect, identified as Muhammad Sikandar, is shot and wounded, and taken into custody; Sikandar, holding two assault rifles and accompanied by his wife and young children,   paralyzed Islamabad for five hours after demanding Pakistan adopt Islamic system of government and that new elections be held under Islamic laws.
lead_paragraph: The man, who was in critical condition, had wielded two assault rifles and demanded that Pakistan adopt an Islamic system of government, paralyzing the capital for hours.

headline.main: Pakistani Gunman Is Shot by Police, Ending Standoff in Islamabad
headline.print_headline: Pakistani Gunman Is Shot By Police, Ending Standoff
